author: hwright
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.c
(svn_wc__db_read_conflicts): Reset a statement after using it.

author: arfrever
msg: Follow-up to r39500:
* subversion/include/svn_wc.h
(svn_wc_revert3): Mark with SVN_DEPRECATED.

author: gstein
msg: Rebuild svn_wc_entry() in terms of svn_wc__get_entry(). The latter
incorporates all of our current Best Practices for fetching, caching, and
handling entries. It will also be the focus of all future changes and
improvements, which can now be picked up by the legacy svn_wc_entry()
function.
This also removes one more use of svn_wc_entries_read(). (yay!)
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c:
(svn_wc__get_entry): note which pool the entries are coming from so that
we can avoid a dup() if it matches the result_pool. this is
particularly important if both are the access baton's pool.
(svn_wc_entry): gut this, and rewrite in terms of get_entry().

author: rhuijben
msg: Don't fall back to reading entries when retrieving an access baton fails,
but use db apis instead.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/deprecated.c
(svn_wc_adm_probe_try2): Moved here from lock.c
* subversion/libsvn_wc/lock.c
(svn_wc_adm_retrieve): Don't retrieve an entry just to provide a nice
error message. Use the database apis instead. Don't check the per
directory administrative area, as that is going to be removed
before 1.7 anyway.
(svn_wc_adm_probe_retrieve): Retrieve node kind via db apis.
(svn_wc_adm_probe_try2): Move to deprecated.c.

author: stsp
msg: Follow-up to r39561:
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(tree_conflict_on_add): We can simply use "SVN_ERR()" here instead of
"return svn_error_return()".
(merge_file_added): Fix type of 'existing_conflict' variable. Didn't see
the warning in the sea of deprecation warnings.
